title: HVAC: Why does unplugging and plugging in the heater make it start working again? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are many things that could cause this kind of behavior.  Far to many to list here.  Here are some generalized possibilities: Depending on the sophistication and style of the heater it may be some sort of intermittent problem caused by an electrical component malfunction.  These kinds of problems can be quite tedious to isolate (even for a trained professional). It essentially requires checking each component in the hopes of catching the malfunction.  It may also have something to do with a safety control.  A safety control is a type of device that shuts the system down if certain tolerances are not met for safety purposes.  Either way the unit is trying to tell you that something is wrong; it should be checked out by a licensed professional (or replaced if it is a cheap space heater).
